reasoning: Portal hypertension is increased pressure in the portal venous system, primarily due to liver cirrhosis. Global prevalence of cirrhosis ~0.15% (150 per 100k), with portal hypertension developing in 50-60% of cirrhosis cases (~45 per 100k prevalent). Annual incidence of new portal hypertension cases ~3-4 per 100k as new cirrhosis cases develop. Major complication leading to variceal bleeding and hepatic encephalopathy.
source: Garcia-Tsao G et al. (2007). Portal hypertension and gastroesophageal varices: diagnosis and management. Gastroenterology. 133(5):1696-1712
